did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity.Alpha Chapter (Cornell University).

did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Files regarding Alpha Phi Alpha and its history, particularly the Cornell chapter.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: Fraternity established at Cornell University, 1906; first black fraternity at Cornell, founded by Henry Arthur Callis, Charles Henry Chapman, Eugene Kinckle Jones, George Biddle Kelley, Nathaniel Allison Murray, Robert Harold Ogle, and Vertner Woodson Tandy.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence between Cornell Alumni News editor John Marcham and Mrs. Donald B. Saunders, September 30, 1968 and October 11, 1968; photographs of Robert H. Ogle, Vertner W. Tandy, George B. Kelley, and Henry A. Callis (chapter officers), and of meeting places and ceremonies; clippings and articles; and posters, handbills, brochures, and other miscellaneous items of Alpha Phi Alpha at Cornell University. Includes Round-Up Banquet programs. Early records from 1910-1929 include minutes of meetings, Annual Convention Reports, committee reports, scrapbook, and correspondence.

Contains materials related to the fraternity's Cornell pilgrimage (2005) and centennial celebration (2006), including a November 19, 2005 album signed by past presidents and members who attended the event and a poster signed by brothers who were present at the December 4, 2006 meeting of the New York Association of Chapters of Alpha.
Complete digitized set of the Sphinx Magazine available on a hard drive.

Master/raw video footage filmed by Rubicon Production, Inc. related to the production of the centennial documentary film entitled Alpha Phi Alpha: A Century of Leadership. Includes 95 Betacam SP Videocassette tapes; 4 DVM 60 Mini digital videocassette tapes; and 4 hard disk drives. The footage includes extensive interviews with many Alpha Phi Alpha fraternity brothers, as well as non-fraternity members; professionally staged re-enactments of historical moments and scenes from the Fraternity's history; and footage from events and activities at the General Conventions in Detroit and Philadelphia. Also an MP3 file containing an interview conducted with brother Dr. Donald Graham.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Box 2 is restricted to members of any chapter of Alpha Phi Alpha with current fraternity ID card. For all other individuals Box 2 requires permission from current members of Alpha Chapter, Iota Iota Lambda Chapter, Alpha Chapter Alumni, or the National Historian, either in person or by signed letter. Discretion should be used when reproducing items from Box 2 regarding placing digital images online. Fraternity also provides list of members. All other boxes are not restricted.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions:
userestrict.p: Due to the nature of electronic records, use of all born digital content on physical media such as CDs, DVDs, floppy disks, zip disks, and external hard drives is limited to digital copies.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Alpha Phi Alpha records, #37-4-2509. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: RELATED MATERIAL
relatedmaterial.p: View the online exhibition on Alpha Phi Alpha here: http://rmc.library.cornell.edu/alpha
Additional digitized publications, including the Sphinx are online here: https://issuu.com/apa1906network

Series IV. Oaths, Initiation, and Convention related material

scopecontent.p: Includes Sphinx publication and other images. Also an MP3 file containing an interview conducted with brother Dr. Donald Graham recorded October 10, 2008 by brother Bertrand Odom-Reed. The interview was conducted by Burt Reed, another one of our fraternity brothers, in Dr. Graham's home in Ithaca. The subject of the interview was Dr. Graham's view of what the fraternity was in his mind, from when he joined to the present day. Also videos and photos from the Robert F. Smith School dedication, October 2016.
